com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.dialogcomponents.swing

Class JScrollPopupMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPopupMenu
            • com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.dialogcomponents.swing.JScrollPopupMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.MenuElement

    public class JScrollPopupMenu
extends javax.swing.JPopupMenu
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    A scrollable popup menu. Similar to a JComboBox menu, this has a default limit of 8 items visible in the dropdown which can be changed by calling setMaxRows(int) Based loosely on https://stackoverflow.com/a/14167008/6076839 and https://stackoverflow.com/a/58413519/6076839
    Author:
    Steve
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
